NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Construction work for buildings relating to railway transport

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01E15

TI_TEXT.P: Строителни и монтажни работи на релсови пътища
Lucrări de construcţii de căi ferate

SHORT_DESCR.P: In October 2014, Network Rail established 11 programme framework contracts for Property, Electrification and Plant, Earthwork and Structures renewals work across a number of regions, pursuant to an OJEU procurement process, the contract notice for which was published 21/06/2013. These frameworks cover repeatable work-types with contract values typically below 5 000 000 GBP.

The initial term covers the CP5 work bank October 2014 to March 2019. Network Rail retained the right to extend the contracts by a period of up-to 5 years. This notice relates to Network Rail's intention to extend the frameworks to cover the CP6 work bank and modify the framework terms for the period of the extension. NR intends to extend the frameworks for all Lots awarded except the frameworks for LNW South Structures work and LNW North (Southern) Property works.

In October 2014, Network Rail established 11 programme framework contracts for Property, Electrification and Plant, Earthwork and Structures renewals work across a number of regions. This framework covers structures programme renewal work in the northern area of the London North West North Route. The initial term covers the CP5 work bank from October 2014 to March 2019.

Network Rail intends to exercise its right to extend this framework and the extension period is intended to be for 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019. Network Rail also intends to make a number of minor amendments to the framework governing the CP6 extension period. Further details are set out in Section VI and Section IV.1.1.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Network Rail retained the option of extending the contract by a period of up to 5 years.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Network Rail is exercising its right to extend the frameworks in accordance with the original procurements and is providing estimated indicative values for the CP6 projects currently anticipated over the framework extension periods. Network Rail is satisfied that this does not constitute the award of a new contract, nor a modification which requires a new procurement procedure in accordance with Regulation 88(9)of the Utilities Contracts Regulations 2016 (UCR).

Network Rail intends to modify the approach to calculating various fees under the frameworks across all Lots for the period of the extension: (1) move the Annual Work Bank (AWB) Management Services Fee to an upfront annual fixed fee rather than a fee on an assumed work bank, reconciliation and minimum fee recovery where volumes are lower, providing more certainty for Network Rail; (2) move from a fee calculation based on actual cost to a target cost approach, which is more reflective of standard market and Network Rail's position. In addition, Network Rail intends to include drafting to remove recovery of ‘fee on fee’ where sub-contractors are used; and (3) the AWB Budget Fee Reconciliation is being deleted as a consequence of (1) and the move to target cost. In relation to (1) – (3), Network Rail considers that the output will be broadly the same but the opportunity for additional fees to be recovered in certain circumstances will be removed to Network Rail’s benefit.

Network Rail also intends to adjust the performance regime in relation to all Lots being extended other than LNW North Electrification & Plant and LNW South Electrification & Plant for the period of the extension: performance is currently taken into account in considering whether work is placed under these frameworks. The adjustment introduces a new right for Network Rail to take performance into account earlier than the current process which is favourable to Network Rail.

Network Rail is satisfied that these changes to the framework terms do not constitute the award of a new contract, nor are modifications which requires a new procurement procedure in accordance with Regulation 88(9) of the UCR. These modifications, which are intended to take effect for the CP6 period commencing in April 2019, fall within regulations 88(1)(e) and 88(8) as the modifications are not ‘substantial’.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: The Sherard Building, Edmund Halley Road

INFO_ADD.P: As highlighted in Section II, Network Rail intends to exercise its right to extend the frameworks for all Lots awarded except the frameworks for LNW South Structures work and LNW North (Southern) Property works and therefore only information in relation to 9 frameworks is provided in Sections II and V. Network Rail intends to extend each framework for 2 years to cover early CP6 project work from April 2019 but continues to reserve its right to extend the frameworks for the full 5 year extension period.

The value stated in Section II.1.7 is the current total estimated value of the CP6 work for the period of the extension across all Lots to be extended. This total estimated value (and each of the values stated in Section V2.4 per Lot from which the total estimated value is derived) are indicative only. As such the value of CP6 Programme work which may be placed during the extension period is likely to vary and may be higher or lower than the estimated values stated within this notice.

Network Rail also intends to modify the approach to calculating various fees under the frameworks for all Lots being extended and adjustments to the performance regime for all Lots being extended except for LNW North E&P and LNW South E&P for the period of the extension. Further details are provided in Section IV.1.1.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The High Court of England and Wales
